text_entities.TRANSLATED_TEXT: We are going to the park
Why write in the group, write to her personally about what you don't like.
Yas was mowing the clover. And the Pesnyary have too many songs in the Belarusian language.
Jerusalem Avenue 30
üì¢ Invitation to a picket in Warsaw

üóì When: December 6 from 14:00 to 16:00
üìç Where: near the building of the Lithuanian Embassy, Al. Ujazdowskie 14
The purpose of the picket

to condemn Lithuania's policy towards the citizens of Belarus. More than 1500 citizens of Belarus have been recognized as a threat to Lithuania's national security. Of particular concern is the case of the Belarusian citizen Vasyl Verameychka, who, having been recognized as a 'threat to national security', was forced to leave the Schengen area and eventually forcibly deported to Belarus, where he faces the death penalty. We express deep concern about Lithuania's actions that violate people's rights and freedoms. Recognizing citizens of Belarus as a threat to national security and their deportation is a gross violation of the European Convention on Human Rights, the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights, the UN Convention against Torture, as well as the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union and the principles of international law. Lithuania has no right to expel citizens to a country where they face torture, the death penalty, and physical violence. Since 2020, Lithuania has received significant financial benefits from cooperation with the Lukashenko regime, as well as from taxes paid by companies and citizens forced to leave their country due to political repression. However, instead of providing support, Lithuania continues a policy that degrades the dignity of these people and violates their rights. We demand: ‚Ä¢ to stop unjust deportations; ‚Ä¢ to conduct an independent investigation of cases of persecution and discrimination of Belarusian citizens; ‚Ä¢ to comply with international law and stop persecution based on nationality. Human rights are universal! They do not depend on skin color or nationality. Persecution based on nationality must be stopped. Come to express your solidarity! Let's fight together for the rights and protection of all Belarusian citizens. Your voice matters.

Dear Lika, Ales, Tamara Mikhaylovna, and all the volunteers of the DAR LOSU foundation. Today, on International Volunteer Day, I want to congratulate you on your professional holiday. After all, a volunteer is also a profession, a calling, a cry of the soul and heart. May your kindness and good deeds come back to you, multiplied a hundredfold. Wishing you and your loved ones happiness and health!
I want to congratulate the Foundation's volunteers! Health, good mood, and peace!!!
Happy holiday, comrades
THANK YOU FOR EVERYTHING!

Good evening. Could you please tell me if there is a minimum employment period required to take two days off for child care for a child under 14? At work, they told me that I am only entitled to one day since I haven't been working for long. But I am reading the labor code, and it doesn't say that. I need to figure this out now because the days will expire at the end of the year.
Childcare days cannot be linked to tenure and working time. It is illogical. Everyone has the same childcare days.

Public holidays in Poland in 2025

üëâ January 1 (Wednesday) - New Year, Holy Mother of God
üëâ January 6 (Monday) - Epiphany (Three Kings Day)
üëâ April 20 (Sunday) - Easter
üëâ April 21 (Monday) - Easter Monday
üëâ May 1 (Thursday) - Labor Day
üëâ May 3 (Saturday) - Constitution Day
üëâ June 8 (Sunday) - Pentecost (Whitsun)
üëâ June 19 (Thursday) - Corpus Christi
üëâ August 15 (Friday) - Polish Armed Forces Day, Assumption of the Blessed Virgin Mary
üëâ November 1 (Saturday) - All Saints' Day
üëâ November 11 (Tuesday) - Independence Day
üëâ December 25 (Thursday) - Christmas (first day)
üëâ December 26 (Friday) - Christmas (second day)

And what kind of 'better' traditions are they? Because I don't know of such caroling with a goat and a crane...
come visit and learn

text_entities.TRANSLATED_TEXT:
Dear Sir/Madam,

The Belarusian Youth Hub (Belarusian space 'Let's do it together') cordially invites journalists and interested parties to a press conference dedicated to our activities in the matter of freeing Belarusian citizens arrested on political grounds (including the ethnic Pole Andrzej Poczobut).

More than 1500 Belarusian citizens have been arrested on political grounds and are held in prison.

The illegitimate Belarusian authorities are purposefully eradicating not only Belarusian identity within Belarus but also Polish - closing Polish schools, Polish language courses, demolishing Polish cemeteries of the Home Army soldiers, and threatening holders of the Pole's Card.

Also, during the event, issues related to the functioning of our organization at the premises located at Constitution Square 6 (formerly 'Nespodzianka') will be raised. This includes the situation related to the actions of the Warsaw city's district authorities concerning our association.

Date: December 19, 2024
Time: 12:00
Place: Constitution Square 6, Warsaw
After returning, you may be asked to show your employment contract. Will you show an excuse?

and in general, it's a rather sketchy explanation, "we can't process the contract due to being busy...". any company has standard contracts with workers, so hiring batches of people or firing them is no big deal. will they pay for the work only after "official registration"?

We've been provided with some interesting figures about the activities of the most "effective" business support structure abroad. ABBA 1 and ABBA 2. In two years, ABBA 2 (ZwiƒÖzek Bia≈Çoruskiego biznesu zagranicƒÖ) received 490,568.71 z≈Çoty in its accounts, of which 323,235.90 or 65 percent went towards salaries for 2-3 employees. ABBA-1 (Association of Belarusian Business Abroad) received 3,324,481.71 z≈Çoty. Salaries accounted for 1,531,151.96 z≈Çoty, or 40 percent. Not counted here are the costs of business trips, etc. This is the kind of business support where on average 40 percent goes directly into the pocket. Documents can be found in the Polish register. For example, through the service.
"Time to get rich", as Yauhen Bury said.
If you have any detailed information about the alleged misuse of EU funds, which may fall under the mandate
(OLAF), which investigates fraud with the EU budget, you can report this directly to OLAF using
and/or inform
an independent European Union prosecutor's office responsible for investigating, prosecuting, and passing judgment on crimes against the financial interests of the EU.

text_entities.TRANSLATED_TEXT: Many thanks for the fact that even in emigration a pensioner can feel Christmas if 'Gift of Fate' is nearby!

Oh!!! Poor pensioners overall! When they rejoice at little gifts, it's at that moment they have been deceived and robbed! The amounts allocated for migrants are hard to even imagine! Those are the realities, gentlemen... They could have given an apartment for a year's use, everyone could have had their teeth fixed! Now those are gifts.

I read your post and am amazed. Although, what is there to be surprised about, in any nation there are those who everyone owes, who are never satisfied, and who have enemies all around. I even felt sick several times from one mustached guy on TV.

You know, there's an example where one type of bacteria is attacked by another, and the first ones line up for defense with large bacteria, they die first, followed by smaller ones (I can imagine women)), and behind them, rows of very tiny ones... But in this row, there are also some thick representatives of the species, so to speak 'hiding.' In other words, parasites. So, dear sir, your view on parasitism surprises me. Someone is in prison, someone else is disabled, someone else is in a Ferrari, someone else says, it's not my problem...

Nothing new... We were in Belarus, lived on grants... Lived well... It's the same here... They don't work anywhere, they rent good housing... Notice - they don't come for rations. But they invite to wave flags... We pretend to be happy üò≠ Don't like it... They will say: suitcase, station...

I would not like to discuss during Lent who owes whom and how much. For many pensioners, disabled people, and large families, this is a huge Gift of fate. Just today we talked about our everyday difficulties... Personally, I wish everyone a happy upcoming year. And we could refuse this assistance in favor of those in need. Thank God for everything.
Probably Alexey agrees, like, it's right that it was stolen! We don't need it, we'll manage on our own.
this is not a grant! This is all kinds of assistance for our emigrants
No one has ever invited me personally.
If you have any detailed information about the alleged misuse of EU funds that may fall under the mandate
(OLAF), which investigates fraud with the EU budget, you can report it to OLAF directly using
and/or inform
an independent European Union prosecutor's office responsible for investigating, prosecuting, and adjudicating crimes against the financial interests of the EU.
This is üëÜ a response to you, Zhanna, regarding the stolen funds by the well-known 'dem-forces'))
In Poland, Belarusians helped me the most
It's evidently in the Belarusians' blood
Help
Only in trouble will you know a person
Who needs help (watching children, helping people with disabilities) I can on Sundays

I don't understand why my gratitude for the help caused such an emotional outburst?! Yulia, if you envy me, I can share my eye cancer and heel spur. But most likely there is a misunderstanding here of the well-fed by the hungry and a lack of basic sense of gratitude. I don't understand what you are calling for? To refuse this, in general, paltry but heartfelt help? For what reason? Do you demand to gather an army and go to rip a piece out of Tikhanovskaya's mouth? Why are the emotions boiling?! People did a good deed! And thank them! That's all!!!
I support you, Alex. I am also grateful to the volunteers of Dar Losu for their help.
But not everyone gets it. Only the disabled.
It's not true, all pensioners receive, including Ukrainian pensioners. I was present at this myself. Therefore, many thanks to all the volunteers from Dar Losy.

Dear friends and brothers Ukrainians, it is very difficult for me to write in Ukrainian because I have never lived in Ukraine. However, I hope that my love for Ukrainian literature will allow me to do this. You won't let us Belarusians anywhere near your charity programs, and in the labor market, you consider yourselves the primary seekers. We are ready to help everyone. It will continue to be so. Yes, you are at war. But many of us were forced to leave for Poland because we opposed this war. We have nothing to share here. Let's be kinder to each other next year. Glory to Ukraine. Long live Belarus.
Thumbs up
The
Unemployment benefit in Poland

Unemployment benefits in Poland are provided to individuals registered with the employment service. They can be granted for 180 or 365 days depending on the unemployment rate in the district and certain conditions, such as being over 50 years old, having children, or if the person is raising children alone.
The amount of aid depends on the length of service:
1329.50 PLN gross for the first 90 days, 1044.15 PLN afterwards.
From 5 to 20 years
1662 z≈Ç gross for the first 90 days, 1305.20 z≈Ç after.
From 20 years:
1994.40 PLN gross for the first 90 days, 1566.24 PLN afterwards. Annually from June 1, the benefit is indexed depending on changes in prices.

Payments are not made if the person is registered as a job seeker rather than unemployed.

P.S: with care about you, dear ones ü•∞
Settle your smile.. I worry about you...

Don't worry about me, I'm a big boy. I make my own decisions, do things myself, and take responsibility for them. I try to get out of a difficult situation if I've gotten myself into one. I don't ask for anything from anyone, and I don't blame anyone for anything. But if I receive help, I am grateful. That's my life philosophy. And thanks for the sympathy.
